content.question: Which of the following scales is played?

choices.label: The figure presents a series of eight descending quarter notes in treble clef. The only accidental used is E-flat.
The figure presents a series of eight descending quarter notes in treble clef. The accidentals used are E-flat and B-flat.
The figure presents a series of eight descending quarter notes in treble clef. The accidentals used are E-flat, B-flat, and A-flat.
The figure presents a series of eight descending quarter notes in treble clef. The accidentals used are E-flat, D-flat, B-flat, and A-flat.

content.answer: The figure presents a series of eight descending quarter notes in treble clef. The accidentals used are E-flat, B-flat, and A-flat.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
